intro: Hibbertia axillaris, commonly known as the slender hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is part of the Dilleniaceae family and is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces yellow or orange flowers that are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. Hibbertia axillaris is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
